Key Match Events: Sean Burke pitched two-hit ball over five innings
Andrew Benintendi tied his career high with his 20th homer
Bryan Ramos added a solo homer
Jackson Jobe had a hitless three-inning relief stint
Post-Match Reflections: A.J. Hinch said they had a couple of chances early to change Sean Burke’s day but couldn’t break through
Detroit manager A.J. Hinch acknowledged the dreary playing conditions
White Sox manager stated Burke’s performance was nothing new for him, considering his background
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chicago White Sox won for the fourth time in a five-game span for only the second time this season
The White Sox won a season-high four straight from May 8-11
Burke held the playoff-bound San Diego to one run and two hits in six innings during his previous outing
Burke held playoff-bound Detroit to two hits in five innings
Burke persevered through dreary playing conditions in Saturday’s start
Michael Soroka didn't allow a baserunner while striking out five in three innings
Gus Varland finished a three-hitter, just the seventh shutout for the White Sox
Jackson Jobe made his second big league appearance, had his first two career strikeouts
